rev.diff:
Line 57: Line 57:
LugRadio Live is an annual event organised by the LugRadio team and held in [[Wolverhampton]]. It is a Linux, Free Software and Open Source event intended to be fun, without the corporate agenda held by other commercial events.<ref>{{cite web|last=Sherriff|first=Lucy|title=LugRadio Live returns|work=Reg Developer|publisher=[[The Register]]|date=2006-05-09|url=http://www.regdeveloper.co.uk/2005/05/09/linux_event_lugradio/|accessdate=2008-03-30}}</ref> It was first held in [[2005]] with 250 attendees, 14 speakers and 18 exhibitors including [[Ubuntu (operating system)|Ubuntu]], [[Debian]], [[KDE]] and [[O'Reilly Media|O'Reilly]].<ref>{{cite web|title=LUGRadio Live 2005 retrospective|url=http://www.lugradio.org/live/2005/index.php/Main_Page|accessdate=2007-05-05}}</ref>
LugRadio Live is an annual event organised by the LugRadio team and held in [[Wolverhampton]]. It is a Linux, Free Software and Open Source event intended to be fun, without the corporate agenda held by other commercial events.<ref>{{cite web|last=Sherriff|first=Lucy|title=LugRadio Live returns|work=Reg Developer|publisher=[[The Register]]|date=2006-05-09|url=http://www.regdeveloper.co.uk/2005/05/09/linux_event_lugradio/|accessdate=2008-03-30}}</ref> It was first held in [[2005]] with 250 attendees, 14 speakers and 18 exhibitors including [[Ubuntu (operating system)|Ubuntu]], [[Debian]], [[KDE]] and [[O'Reilly Media|O'Reilly]].<ref>{{cite web|title=LUGRadio Live 2005 retrospective|url=http://www.lugradio.org/live/2005/index.php/Main_Page|accessdate=2007-05-05}}</ref>
â
In [[2006]] LugRadio Live saw around 400 attendees, over 30 speakers including [[Mark Shuttleworth]] (who arrived by helicopter<ref>{{cite web|title=Jon Masters' blog - Lugradio Live|url=http://www.jonmasters.org/wordpress/index.php?p=300|accessdate=2007-10-19}}</ref>) and [[Michael Meeks]] and 27 exhibitors including [[Ubuntu (Linux distribution)|Ubuntu]], [[OpenSolaris]], [[KDE]], [[MythTV]], [[Debian]], [[Fedora Project|Fedora]] and [[GNOME]].<ref>{{citation|last=Goodwin|first=Katherine|title=LugRadio Live 2006|newspaper=[[Linux User and Developer]] #66|date=October 2006}}</ref>
+
In [[2006]] LugRadio Live saw around 400 attendees, over 30 speakers including [[Mark Shuttleworth]] (who arrived by helicopter<ref>{{cite web|title=Jon Masters' blog - Lugradio Live|url=http://www.jonmasters.org/wordpress/index.php?p=300|accessdate=2007-10-19}}</ref>) and [[Michael Meeks]] and 27 exhibitors including [[Ubuntu (operating system)|Ubuntu]], [[OpenSolaris]], [[KDE]], [[MythTV]], [[Debian]], [[Fedora Project|Fedora]] and [[GNOME]].<ref>{{citation|last=Goodwin|first=Katherine|title=LugRadio Live 2006|newspaper=[[Linux User and Developer]] #66|date=October 2006}}</ref>
LugRadio Live 2007 took place on 7-8th July 2007 at the Light House Media Centre, Wolverhampton attracting hundreds of attendees from around the world. Speakers included [[Chris DiBona]] ([[Google]]), [[Gervase Markham]] ([[Mozilla]]) and a representative from the [[Communities and Local Government|Department for Communities and Local Government]].<ref>{{cite web|last=Wellsted|first=Ron|title=Talking about a revolution|work=BBC Black Country|publisher=[[BBC]]|date=2007-07-13|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/blackcountry/content/articles/2007/07/13/lugradio_live_2007_feature.shtml|accessdate=2008-03-30}}</ref>
LugRadio Live 2007 took place on 7-8th July 2007 at the Light House Media Centre, Wolverhampton attracting hundreds of attendees from around the world. Speakers included [[Chris DiBona]] ([[Google]]), [[Gervase Markham]] ([[Mozilla]]) and a representative from the [[Communities and Local Government|Department for Communities and Local Government]].<ref>{{cite web|last=Wellsted|first=Ron|title=Talking about a revolution|work=BBC Black Country|publisher=[[BBC]]|date=2007-07-13|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/blackcountry/content/articles/2007/07/13/lugradio_live_2007_feature.shtml|accessdate=2008-03-30}}</ref>
